Front: Why can't CNNs be directly applied to graphs?
Back: Graphs have irregular structure with varying node degrees and no spatial ordering

Front: What is a graph neural network (GNN)?
Back: Deep learning model that operates on graph data, capturing dependencies via connectivity

Front: What is one application area of GNNs?
Back: Text classification

Front: What is another application area of GNNs?
Back: Drug discovery

Front: What is a third application area of GNNs?
Back: Recommender systems

Front: What is a fourth application area of GNNs?
Back: Traffic forecasting

Front: Graph G is defined as {{c1::(V, E)}}: V = {{c2::nodes}}, E = {{c3::edges}}
Adjacency matrix A has shape {{c1::|V| x |V|}}
How do directed vs undirected graphs differ in adjacency matrix?
Back: Undirected: symmetric (x_ij = x_ji); Directed: not necessarily symmetric

Front: What is a labeled graph?
Back: Graph with additional features associated with nodes and/or edges

Front: Node feature matrix X has shape {{c1::|V| x f_V}}
How are molecules represented as graphs?
Back: Atoms = nodes, bonds = edges, with features for atom/bond types

Front: Three priors for convolutions: {{c1::shift-invariance}}, {{c2::locality}}, {{c3::hierarchy}}
{{c1::Permutation invariance}} means node ordering doesn't affect GNN output
Graph convolution: x'_i = x_i W_1 + {{c1::sum over j in N(i)}} x_j W_2 + b
What is the message-passing framework?
Back: Nodes collect messages from neighbors, aggregate, and update their representations

Front: Message aggregation: m_i = {{c1::sum over j in N(i)}} M_t(h_i, h_j, e_ij)
Node update: h_i^(t+1) = {{c1::U_t(h_i^(t), m_i)}}
Why does stacking convolutions capture distant relationships?
Back: Each layer sees immediate neighbors; k layers = k hops of information

Front: Global pooling aggregates node embeddings into {{c1::fixed-sized output}}
Global pooling functions must be {{c1::permutation invariant}} (sum, max, mean)
How does batching work for varying-size graphs?
Back: Treat batch as single large graph with disconnected subgraphs

Front: PyTorch Geometric Data: {{c1::x}} for nodes, {{c2::edge_attr}} for edges, {{c3::edge_index}} for connectivity
What is NNConv?
Back: Graph conv where neighbor weights are parameterized by neural network on edge features

Front: What is the QM9 dataset?
Back: ~134,000 small organic molecules with physical property labels

Front: Graph Laplacian: L = {{c1::D - A}} (D = degree matrix, A = adjacency)
Degree matrix D is {{c1::diagonal}} with D_ii = {{c2::degree of node i}}
What is the main drawback of spectral graph convolutions?
Back: O(n^3) eigendecomposition complexity; weight matrix depends on graph size

Front: What three graph-level tasks exist?
Back: Node classification, edge prediction, graph classification

Front: What is DiffPool?
Back: Learns soft cluster assignment matrix for hierarchical graph pooling

Front: What is top-k pooling?
Back: Drops nodes based on projection score against learnable vector

Front: GraphNorm: {{c1::alpha}} controls how much mean to discard
What are Graph Attention Networks (GATs)?
Back: GNNs using attention to weight neighbor importance during aggregation

Front: What must aggregation functions be for message passing?
Back: Permutation invariant - output doesn't depend on neighbor order

Front: Receptive field of one graph conv: {{c1::immediate neighbors}}
To capture k hops away: stack {{c1::k convolutions}}
